title: How to Dress Professionally As a Lifeguard

steps.headline: Your guard suit should be worn at all times.
steps.description: Even there are only a few people in the pool, you should wear it.

steps.headline: Rule of thumb: an article of clothing that says "Lifeguard" should be visible at all times.
steps.description: A suit or shirt is acceptable.

steps.headline: Your employers may issue a t-shirt, tank-top, or long sleeve shirt; this should be worn as often as possible.
In hot weather, it is usually acceptable for male guards to wear just their shorts.
steps.description: Female guards should wear their suits with black, navy, gray, or red shorts.

steps.headline: Waterproof flip flops or sneakers should be worn at all times.
You should always have a whistle on a lanyard with you while on duty.
steps.description: Depending on your place of employment, you may also need to have a face mask, disposable gloves, or an air horn with you.

steps.headline: Sunglasses are very helpful when it's sunny or even overcast, since the light reflecting off the water can cause glare.
